title: Happy Hour: Waterlogged
author: Christy Frink
excerpt: We thought we had a lot to complain about here in Nashville with our eight inches of rain, but then we saw Atlanta. Two Metro schools went on lockdown
contentEncoded:
• We thought we had a lot to complain about here in Nashville with our eight inches of rain, but then we saw Atlanta. [TwitPic]
  • Two Metro schools went on lockdown today after a boy’s mother called up school officials and told them she was afraid he was toting a gun. Thankfully, no weapons were found. [WSMV]
  • The Sommet Center won the bid for the first two rounds of the  2012 NCAA Men’s Basketball tournament. Congratulations to us! [Tennessean]
  • An MTSU student was busted for allegedly running a counterfeit money operation, which we suspect was probably a little more advanced than this. [WSMV]
  • A group is trying to save the Tennessee State Fair by pointing out that canceling it may actually be illegal. [WSMV]
  • Some middle Tennessee counties are looking at tax hikes, but ours is not one of them. [WTVF]

Photo by Paul Nicholson.
